segment.source: How to Configure Servers for ESD-Based Deployment
segment.target: How to Configure Servers for ESD-Based Deployment

segment.source: How to Configure Servers for ESD-Based Deployment
segment.target: How to Configure Servers for ESD-Based Deployment

segment.source: How to Configure Servers for ESD-Based Deployment
segment.target: How to Configure Servers for ESD-Based Deployment

segment.source: This section provides procedures you can use to configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers, the IIS server, and the file server for your electronic software distribution–based deployment strategy.
segment.target: This section provides procedures you can use to configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers, the IIS server, and the file server for your electronic software distribution–based deployment strategy.

segment.source: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers
segment.target: How to Configure the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers

segment.source: Provides a step-by-step procedure for configuring the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers.
segment.target: Provides a step-by-step procedure for configuring the Application Virtualization Streaming Servers.

segment.source: How to Configure the Server for IIS
segment.target: How to Configure the Server for IIS

segment.source: Provides a step-by-step procedure for configuring the IIS server for your electronic software distribution deployment.
segment.target: Provides a step-by-step procedure for configuring the IIS server for your electronic software distribution deployment.

segment.source: How to Configure the File Server
segment.target: How to Configure the File Server

segment.source: Provides a step-by-step procedure for configuring a local computer that is used as a file share and that streams applications to the Application Virtualization Desktop Client and the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), for a deployment strategy where your site does not have server-class hardware installed.
segment.target: Provides a step-by-step procedure for configuring a local computer that is used as a file share and that streams applications to the Application Virtualization Desktop Client and the Client for Remote Desktop Services (formerly Terminal Services), for a deployment strategy where your site does not have server-class hardware installed.

segment.source: How to Install the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Install the Servers and System Components

segment.source: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
segment.target: How to Upgrade the Servers and System Components
